refnamediv.refpurpose: Important things to know when testing against the NSM dummy implementation

refsect1.title: Notes about the NSM dummy behaviour
refsect1.para: We do not guarantee that our NSM dummy is functional equivalent to the real NSM. The dummy does however, provide the same interfaces and the behaviour of all public methods used by the Node Startup Controller should be very similar to that of the real NSM.
We implemented a few special features in the NSM dummy that make testing the Node Startup Controller easier:

itemizedlist.listitem: com.contiautomotive.NodeStateManager.LifecycleControl.CheckLucRequired will alternative between returning TRUE and FALSE with every call. This way we can test how the Node Startup Controller behaves with and without starting the LUC simply by starting it twice.

com.contiautomotive.NodeStateManager.LifecycleControl.SetNodeState will alternative between accepting the state and not accepting the state with every call. This way we can test how the Node Startup Controller handles both scenarios.
The NSM dummy will shut down all registered shutdown consumers upon receiving SIGHUP. This allows to test the shutdown sequence by running the following command: kill -s HUP $(pidof nsm-dummy)

Unlike the real NSM, which only ever shuts down using one shutdown mode, the NSM dummy will shut down the consumers for all modes. The modes are isolated from each other to avoid undesired side-effects of this difference in implementation.
